text:
Prevention of implementation of certain proposals for single tier of localgovernment
	After the commencement of this Act, no further relevant order may be madeunder section 7 of the 2007 Act (power to implement proposals for a singletier of local government for an area).
	In this section—
		  * a “relevant order” means an order implementing (with or without modifications) a proposal received by the Secretary of State before the commencement of this Act; 
		  * “the 2007 Act” means the Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007. 
Extent, commencement and short title
	This Act extends to England and Wales only.
	This Act comes into force on the day on which it is passed.
	This Act may be cited as the Local Government Act 2010.
